Articles.Content:
I would like to know would it be posible to create a SAS-like part that can be controled to pilot it to were ever you want to go (So basicly Go to Kerbal, Orbit around Kerbal, Go to Mun, Orbit Mun, Got to Sun, and Orbit Sun)

Is this possible? Or am I just going to have to learn how to drive better?

Eventually there will be programmable systems you can use to do things like this. For now though, you just need to practice the old fashioned way.

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky
Crud, I guess Im just going to have to keep flying into the sun and call it a technical error.
Perhaps one day I will be able to deploy working satalites, do Space Walks, Maybe set up a moon base or at least an IKSS(International Kerbling Space Station).
One day, good sir. One day soon, I\'m sure.

One day, good sir. One day in the distant future, I\'m sure.

I have repaired your previously repairable sentence.

Aw, People are fighting over grammar here.

....

At least you people are better the SWS...
No, he\'s saying it\'ll take more time than simply 'soon.'

Well, It depends...

What is the game coded in?

It\'s coded in pure binarylove and caffeine

Fixed that for ya.

One day, good sir. One day soon, I\'m sure.

Jesus said He was coming \'soon\'...

Sentence is still applicable; this game\'ll be finished in less than 1979 years, I\'m sure!

Perhaps one day I will be able to deploy working satalites, do Space Walks, Maybe set up a moon base or at least an IKSS(International Kerbling Space Station).

I want this.. i want this a lot
May Sqaud will build a kind of a Flight Computer (to planets, orbits )

Right now my \'autopilot\' is the advanced SAS module which functions as a good \'attitude hold\' autopilot for winged or aero-stabilised rockets.

How good it works depends on your design of course...
Translation: No, we have the Mun, so we have Kerbol?

No way to go to the SON yes we have MUN so we have SON

Please check to make sure your posts actually make sense before posting them.

With some tinkering with engine thrust and tailfins an aerodynamical vehicle (even not containing a command pod!) can be made to steadily keep chosen course and altitude. Refer to the posts starting with this one: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=6341.msg85631#msg85631

That\'s not exactly an \'autopilot\', but it still works))
